p: Previously, we generated a recombinant IAV expressing Gaussia luciferase, based on which a phenotypic high-throughput screening approach was subsequently established, providing a powerful tool for antiviral discovery [ 11, 12, 15]. A phenotypic screening was therefore carried out against the prefractionated TCM library for anti-influenza actives. The practical screening procedure is shown in Figure 2. Primarily, the inhibitory potency of each TCM fraction at 20 μg/mL against IAV was determined. The Z′ value of each screening plate (ranges from 0.55 to 0.89) was evaluated as quality control ( Figure 3(a)). As a result, 47 samples showing >80% inhibition were cherry-picked as primary hits and subjected to a second round of antiviral determination as well as cytotoxicity assay (Figures 2 and 3(a)). Among the 47 primary hits, 13 were excluded due to cytotoxicity, 24 were confirmed as inactives, and the 10 leftover hit fractions were shortlisted for dose-response analysis ( Figure 3(b)).
